text: Hey everyone :wave: just a heads up - we released a minor version of boilerplate v1.6 here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases/tag/v1.6.0>) that was focused on some bug fixes, performance updates, and accessibility updates. We also have a project board for v2.0 available for tracking (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/projects/7>) which will mainly be focused on introducing a couple of new upcoming features (separated blog template types and DND in global partials).
Hey Aaron would you be able to file an issue in the repo here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-vue-boilerplate>) so that someone can take a closer look at the error you are getting?
hi <@U019EKLPY90> did you run `npm install` or `yarn install` first? which OS are you using?

Sure thing, using windows 10. I npm installed it.
Somethings not right with the default scripts. Removing rm Rtf dist, makes it “work” but I’m unfamiliar with webpack beyond this, and it sometimes updates through HubSpot when it’s being watched.

I wonder if it’s a Windows or permissions thing. If you change the `start` script from…
```"start": "rm -rf dist && webpack --watch --env autoupload --mode production"```
to
```"start": "rmdir /S /Q dist && webpack --watch --env autoupload --mode production"```
does that work?
